sentences.sContent: ‘Do you reckon Margot will be there?’ ‘ Definitely not .’
sentences.sCn: “你估计玛戈会在那里吗？” “肯定不会。”

sentences.sContent: The hotel fitness centre is definitely worth a visit.
sentences.sCn: 这家酒店的健身中心绝对值得一去。

sentences.sContent: ...we should definitely not jump to conclusions upon seeing or hearing something...
...no one is definitely immune to problems...
...This experiment certainly does not definitely prove that girls start to reason before boys...
...Opportunities may count; and a person’s own efforts and decisions definitely count; but a name simply functions as the way of the person being called by others...

synos.tran: 清楚地，当然；明确地，肯定地

words.tran: 有定义的，确定的；清晰的，轮廓分明的
决定性的；最后的；限定的
最典型的；起决定性作用的
可下定义的；可确定的；可限定的
定义；[物] 清晰度；解说
确定性，定指；明确；清晰度；梅性
使明确；给...下定义；使...的轮廓分明（define的过去分词）
规定（define的ing形式）；给…下定义；表明特征
